name: Arcane - Critical Failure
description: Arcane criticals only occur when an active magical effect is involved. This might be the response to a counterspell or dispel magic, the activation of a specific magic item, or interaction with a ritual or permanent enchantment. When an arcane critical success or critical failure would not apply to the effect that activated it, reroll.

results.text: You take 1 point of damage per spell level.
The activated item gains the broken condition or, in the case of a scroll it is destroyed entirely.
At some point within the next [[1d12]] hours, the magic device randomly activates. The target is chosen by the Narrator.
The device activates, but the target of the item's effect or spell changes to a target of the Narrator's choosing.
You are rattled for the next [[2d4]] hours.
If activating an item with charges (such as a wand), you use 5 charges (even if the device does not activate).
